text: [Applause]
[Music]
hello i'm vaishnavi a cloud support
engineer here at the ews office in
bengaluru india
we all want to optimize performance
while using any service and the same
goes with amazon simple storage service
customers ask me how they can optimize
performance when uploading large files
to amazon s3 other than leveraging the
multi-part uploads which are performed
automatically when using all high level
aws s3 commands such as aws sync and ews
copy today i am going to show you how
in this video i will show you how to
optimize performance when you upload
large files to amazon s3 by the
following methods
if you are using the aws cli you can
customize upload configurations these
are the configuration values that you
can specify for the aws s3 command set
you can use max concurrent request to
set the value of number of requests that
can be sent to amazon s3 at one time the
default value is 10.
you can use max queue size to set value
of the maximum number of tasks in the
queue
you can use multipath threshold to set
the value of the size threshold for
multipart uploads of individual files
you can use multipath chunk size to set
the value of the size of each part that
the aws cli uploads in a multipart
upload for an individual file this
setting allows you to break down a
larger file for example 300 nb into
smaller parts for quicker upload speeds
you can use max bandwidth to set the
value of the maximum bandwidth for
uploading data to amazon s3 you can also
optimize performance when uploading
large files to amazon s3 by enabling
amazon s3 transfer acceleration
this can provide fast and secure
transfers over long distances between
your client and amazon s3
transfer acceleration uses amazon cloud
funds globally distributed edge
locations to enable transfer
acceleration for an s3 bucket via s3
console sign in to the aws management
console and then navigate to s3 console
in the buckets list choose the name of
the bucket that you want to enable
transfer acceleration for choose
properties
under transfer acceleration choose edit
choose enable
and choose save changes
note that transfer acceleration incurs
additional charges so be sure to review
pricing before you use it i hope this
video provided you insights to achieve
optimized performance when you upload
large files to amazon s3 thanks for
watching and happy cloud computing from
all of us here at aws
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
